sections.title: Questions about sinus lifts and implants

faqs.question: Do I often need a sinus lift for upper implants?
faqs.answer: No. We only advise a sinus lift when scans show it would improve implant stability.

faqs.question: Is a sinus lift painful?
faqs.answer: Treatment is carried out with local anaesthetic. Some soreness afterwards is expected and we support you with guidance.

faqs.question: How long does healing take?
faqs.answer: Healing times vary by case and are reviewed at follow-up appointments before moving to implant placement.

faqs.question: Can I have temporary teeth while healing?
faqs.answer: In many situations we can discuss a temporary option to maintain appearance while healing progresses.

faqs.question: Are there alternatives to a sinus lift?
faqs.answer: Sometimes shorter implants or angulated approaches may be possible. We review options once scans are assessed.

faqs.question: What are the risks?
faqs.answer: Risks can include swelling, sinus discomfort, or graft healing delays. We explain these and monitor recovery closely.

faqs.question: Will it delay my implant treatment?
faqs.answer: A healing phase is usually needed before implant placement. Timelines are shared so you know what to expect.

faqs.question: How much does a sinus lift cost?
faqs.answer: Costs depend on the complexity and any staged care. After assessment we provide a tailored plan with fees for each step.
